summary: toxoplasma gondii is an obligate intracellular parasite of the apicomplexan phylum. it is capable of infecting a wide range of mammals, including humans. the parasite avoids phagocytosis and instead actively invades its host cell. parasite resides in a stable parasitophorous vacuole (PV) where it replicates. the major differences in mouse virulence among these strain types have been mapped to a polymorphic family of rhoptry kinases including ROP18 and ROP5 (16) these determinants have been shown to play a major role in combating host defense in gamma interferon (IFN-)-activated cells. deletion of the GBP cluster of chromosome 3 makes mice more susceptible to T. gondii infection. mice lacking NLRP1B (37) or NLRP3 or caspase-1 (38) are more susceptible to type II parasite infection. NADPH oxidases (Nox) are multimeric enzyme complexes that generate superoxide free radicals upon activation. gp91phox (Nox2) and p22phox subunits that reside in the plasma membrane recruit other cytosolic subunits to convert NADPH to NADP+ and hence generate superoxide radicals (41). Upon activation, nox rapidly generates elevated production of ROS (defined as respiratory burst) in naive macrophages with avirulent type III T. gondii, parasites induced Nox-dependent ROS production and Gbp5 expression. both factors are involved in clearance of type III parasites from naive macrophages independent of prior activation with IFN- and independent of classical inflammasome activation that can be primed by LPS. findings reveal novel roles for cell-intrinsic factors in controlling intracellular pathogens T. gondii is generally regarded as a pathogen that survives in naive macrophages. intracellular survival of GT1 (type I) and CTG (type III) parasites in naive bone marrow-derived macrophages at 20 h expressed as percentage of initial infection at 0.5 h. macrophages were challenged with parasites at an MOI of 0.5, washed, fixed, and stained with SAG1 to detect images were costained with host cell markers LAMP1 (MAb ID4B, green), LAMP2 (rat MAb GL2A7, green), autophagy adapter p62 (rat MAb GL2A7, green), or ubiquitin FK2 (MAb FK2, red). images were analyzed using custom-designed cellProfiler project template.
